title: Fact Check: This video is of German army, not Indian army
subtitle:
New Delhi  Team
Vishvas । A video
post was shared on Facebook by a Facebook page Indian Army  in which an army
truck can be seen stuck in loose mud The video shows an Army truck driver
struggling in mud and finally manages to come out of it  The text accompanying the video reads 
India Army Sad...
author: www.vishvasnews.com
vclaim:
New Delhi (Team Vishvas)। A video post was shared on Facebook by a Facebook page Indian Army, in which an army truck can be seen stuck in loose mud. The video shows an Army truck driver struggling in mud and finally manages to come out of it. The text accompanying the video reads, “India Army Sad Video .. The struggles of Indian Army”. In our fact check, we found that this video belongs to the German Army, not the Indian Army.

Upon seeing this video, Team Vishvas found that the sound in the background was not Hindi or any other Indian language. We put this video on Invid and Yandex and searched the thumb images. We found this video on the first page itself in search.

This video was originally uploaded on Youtube on May 5, 2016.

Upon analyzing this video on Youtube Data Viewer, we found out that this video was originally uploaded on YouTube by ‘Klaus Schröder Militär- und Landtechnik. The video’s subject was “Tatra 813 sunk in the mud, Peckfitz 2016(Translated). ′ and description was “Tatra 813 sunk in the mud hole, mountain test with MAN and Ural, salvaged by SPz BMP on Father’s Day in Peckfitz, 5 May 2016. Driver offers some action visuals to the visitors”(Translated).

By this description, it is clear that the video was shot in Peckfitz, Germany on May 5, 2016.

We Stalkscan searched the facebook page Indian Army and found out that this is not the official page of Indian Army. The page’s handle is @iSupportBharatArmy. The page has a total of 89,909 followers. Most of the posts on this page are related to Indian Army. The page was created on October 5, 2016.

Conclusion: In fact Check, we found that the post shared by Facebook page Indian Army is false. The video is from Germany and not from India.

Knowing the truth is your right. If you have a doubt on any news that could impact you, society or the nation, let us know. You can share your doubts and send you news for fact verification on our mail ID contact@vishvasnews.com or whatsapp us on 9205270923.
